pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:5.1: 28. The training rule on receiving with attention on the bowl
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood while looking here and there, and they did not know that people were still giving and that they had received too much. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:7.2: “‘I will receive almsfood with attention on the bowl,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:8.1: Almsfood is to be received with attention on the bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect receives almsfood while looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:10.1: The eighth training rule is finished.
